verses.original: ॥ ओं नमो भगवते रुद्राय ॥ नमस्ते रुद्रमन्यव उतोत इषवेनमः । नमस्ते अस्तु धन्वने बाहुभ्या-मुत तेनमः
verses.transliteration: om namo bhagavate rudrāya | namaste rudra manyava utota iṣave namaḥ | namaste astu dhanvane bāhubhyā-muta te namaḥ
verses.translation: Om. Salutations to the worshipful Rudra. Salutations to your anger, O Rudra, and to your arrow. Salutations to your bow and to your two arms. Salutations O Lord, Salutations O Bow Armed Lord.

verses.original: यात इषुः शिवतमा शिवं बभूव तेधनुः । शिवा शरव्या या तव तया नोरुद्र मृडय
verses.transliteration: yā ta iṣuḥ śivatamā śivaṃ babhūva te dhanuḥ | śivā śaravyā yā tava tayā no rudra mṛḍaya
verses.translation: O Rudra, with your arrow that is supremely auspicious, and with your bow that has become auspicious, and with your quiver which is auspicious, make us happy. O Lord, give us happiness, O wielder of Bows & Arrows.

verses.original: या तेरुद्र शिवा तनू-रघोराऽपापकाशिनी । तया नस्तनुवा शन्तमया गिरिशंताभिचाकशीहि
verses.transliteration: yā te rudra śivā tanū-raghorā'pāpakāśinī | tayā nastanuvā śantamayā giriśaṃtābhicākaśīhi
verses.translation: O Rudra, your form is auspicious, not terrible, and does not reveal sin. With that most peaceful form, O mountain-dweller who grants peace, shine upon us. O Lord Rudra, One with terrible form, destroyer of sins. With your peaceful, auspiciousness bless us.

verses.original: यामिषुं गिरिशंत हस्ते बिभर्ष्यस्तवे। शिवां गिरित्र तां कुरु मा हिसीः पुरुषं जगत्
verses.transliteration: yāmiṣuṃ giriśaṃta haste bibharṣyastave | śivāṃ giritra tāṃ kuru mā hiṃsīḥ puruṣaṃ jagat
verses.translation: O mountain-dweller who grants peace, the arrow you hold in your hand to shoot, make it auspicious, O mountain protector! Do not injure man or the world. O Lord living in the Mountains, giver of good things. Make us peaceful, let the material world exist.

verses.original: शिवेन वचसा त्वा गिरिशाच्छा वदामसि । यथा नः सर्वमिज्जगदयक्ष्मसुमना असत्
verses.transliteration: śivena vacasā tvā giriśācchā vadāmasi | yathā naḥ sarvamijjagadayakṣmasumanā asat
verses.translation: We address you, O mountain dweller, with auspicious speech, so that this entire world may be free from disease and be kindly disposed towards us. O Lord of the great mountain of the Scriptures! We pray that the world be free from evil and be full of kindness.

verses.original: अध्यवोचदधि वक्ता प्रथमो दैव्यो भिषक् । अहीश्च सर्वाञ्जंभयन्त्सर्वाश्च यातुधान्यः
verses.transliteration: adhyavocadadhi vaktā prathamo daivyo bhiṣak | ahīśca sarvāñjambhayantsarvāśca yātudhānyaḥ
verses.translation: Let the divine physician, the first orator, speak on our behalf, paralyzing all snakes and all sorcerers.

verses.original: असौ यस्ताम्रो अरुण उत बभ्रुः सुमंगलः । ये चेमारुद्रा अभितो दिक्षु। श्रिताः सहस्रशोऽवैषाहेड ईमहे
verses.transliteration: asau yastāmro aruṇa uta babhruḥ sumaṃgalaḥ | ye cemārudrā abhito dikṣu | śritāḥ sahasraśo’vaiṣāheḍa īmahe
verses.translation: That one who is copper-red, reddish-brown, and tawny, who is supremely auspicious—and those Rudras who thousands of times are around him in all directions—we deprecate their wrath.

verses.original: असौ योऽवसर्पति नीलग्रीवो विलोहितः । उतैनं गोपा अदृशन्नदृशन्नुदहार्यः । उतैनं विश्वा भूतानि स दृष्टो मृडयाति नः
verses.transliteration: asau yo’vasarpati nīlagrīvo vilohitaḥ | utainaṃ gopā adṛśannadṛśannudahāryaḥ | utainaṃ viśvā bhūtāni sa dṛṣṭo mṛḍayāti naḥ
verses.translation: That one who creeps away, blue-necked and deeply red; the cowherds and the water-carriers have seen him; all creatures have seen him. May he, when seen, make us happy.

verses.original: नमो अस्तु नीलग्रीवाय सहस्राक्षाय मीढुषे। अथो ये अस्य सत्वानोऽहं तेभ्योऽकरन्नमः
verses.transliteration: namo astu nīlagrīvāya sahasrākṣāya mīḍhuṣe | atho ye asya satvāno’haṃ tebhyo’karannamaḥ
verses.translation: Salutations to the blue-necked, the thousand-eyed, the generous one. And to those who are his attendants, I offer salutations.

verses.original: प्रमुंच धन्वनस्त्व-मुभयो-रार्त्नियो-र्ज्याम्। याश्च ते हस्त इषवः परा ता भगवो वप
verses.transliteration: pramuñca dhanvanastva-mubhayorārtniyorjyām | yāśca te hasta iṣavaḥ parā tā bhagavo vapa
verses.translation: Release the bowstring from both ends of your bow, and O Lord (Bhagavan), cast away those arrows which are in your hand.

verses.original: अवतत्य धनुस्त्व सहस्राक्ष शतेषुधे। निशीर्य शल्यानां मुखा शिवो नः सुमना भव
verses.transliteration: avatatya dhanustva sahasrākṣa śateṣudhe | niśīrya śalyānāṃ mukhā śivo naḥ sumanā bhava
verses.translation: Having loosened your bow, O thousand-eyed, hundred-quivered one, and having shattered the points of the arrows, be auspicious and kind to us.

verses.original: विज्यं धनुः कपर्दिनो विशल्यो बाणवा उत । अनेशन्नस्येषव आभुरस्य निषंगथिः
verses.transliteration: vijyaṃ dhanuḥ kapardino viśalyo bāṇavā uta | aneśannasyeṣava ābhurasyaniṣaṃgathiḥ
verses.translation: May the bow of the braided-hair God (Kapardin) be without string, and the arrows without shafts. May his arrows be powerless and his quiver without strength.

verses.original: या ते हेति-र्मीढुष्टम हस्ते बभूव ते धनुः । तयाऽस्मान्विश्वतस्त्व-मयक्ष्मया परिब्भुज
verses.transliteration: yā te heti-rmīḍhuṣṭama haste babhūva te dhanuḥ | tayā’smānviśvatastva-mayakṣmayā paribhbuja
verses.translation: O most generous one, with the weapon and the bow that are in your hand, protect us from all sides with an auspiciousness that is free from disease.

verses.original: नमस्ते अस्त्वायुधायानातताय धृष्णवे। उभाभ्यामुत ते नमो बाहुभ्यां तव धन्वने
verses.transliteration: namaste astvāyudhāyānātatāya dhṛṣṇave | ubhābhyāmuta te namo bāhubhyāṃ tava dhanvane
verses.translation: Salutations to your unstrung, bold weapon. And salutations to your two arms and to your bow.

verses.original: परि ते धन्वनो हेति-रस्मान्व्रुणक्तु विश्वतः । अथो य इषुधिस्तवारे अस्मन्निधेहि तम् ॥ नमस्तेअस्तुभगवन् विश्वेश्वराय महादेवाय त्र्यंबकाय त्रिपुरान्तकाय त्रिकाग्नि-कालाय कालाग्निरुद्राय नीलकण्ठाय म्रुत्युंजयाय सर्वेश्वराय सदाशिवाय श्रीमन्महादेवाय नमः
verses.transliteration: pari te dhanvano heti-rasmānvruṇaktu viśvataḥ | atho ya iṣudhistavāre asmannidhehi tam || namaste astu bhagavan viśveśvarāya mahādevāya tryaṃbakāya tripurāntakāya trikāgni-kālāya kālāgnirudrāya nīlakaṇṭhāya mṛtyuṃjayāya sarveśvarāya sadāśivāya śrīmanmahādevāya namaḥ
verses.translation: May the missile of your bow avoid us from all sides. And place your quiver far away from us. Salutations to you, O Lord, the Lord of the Universe (Viśveśvara), the Great God (Mahādeva), the three-eyed one (Tryaṃbaka), the destroyer of the three cities (Tripurāntaka), the destroyer of the three-Kāla-fire, the destroyer-Rudra in the form of Time, the blue-throated (Nīlakaṇṭha), the conqueror of death (Mṛtyuṃjaya), the Lord of all (Sarveśvara), the eternally auspicious (Sadāśiva). Salutations to Śrīman Mahādeva.

verses.original: नमो हिरण्यबाहवे सेनान्ये दिशां च पतये नमो
verses.transliteration: namo hiraṇyabāhave senānye diśāṃ ca pataye namo
verses.translation: Salutations to him with golden arms (Hiraṇyabāhu), to the commander of the army (Senāni), and to the Lord of the quarters.

verses.original: नमो वृक्षेभ्यो हरिकेशेभ्यः पशूनां पतये नमो
verses.transliteration: namo vṛkṣebhyo harikeśebhyaḥ paśūnāṃ pataye namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the trees, to him whose hair is green like the foliage of trees (Harikeśa), and to the Lord of all creatures (Paśupati).

verses.transliteration: namo saspiñcarāya tviṣīmate patheenaam pataye namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the yellowish-red (Saspiñcara) and radiant one, and to the Lord of the paths (Pathināṃ Pati).

verses.transliteration: namo babhlu śāaya vivyādhine annānām pataye namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the reddish-brown (Babhluśa), who pierces (evil), and to the Lord of food (Annānāṃ Pati).

verses.transliteration: namo harike śāyopavītine puṣṭānām pataye namo
verses.translation: Salutations to him with green hair, wearing the sacred thread (Upavītin), and to the Lord of the nourished (Puṣṭānāṃ Pati).

verses.transliteration: namo bhavasya hetyai jagatām pataye namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the cause of existence (Bhavasya Heti), and to the Lord of the worlds (Jagatāṃ Pati).

verses.transliteration: namo rudrāyātatāvine kṣetrāṇām pataye namo
verses.translation: Salutations to Rudra, the unstringer of the bow, and to the Lord of the fields (Kṣetrāṇāṃ Pati).

verses.transliteration: namo suutāyaa hantyāya vanānām pataye namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the charioteer (Sūta), the fearless one, and to the Lord of the forests (Vanānāṃ Pati).

verses.transliteration: namo rohitāya sthapataye vṛkṣāṇām pataye namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the red one (Rohita), to the master builder (Sthapati), and to the Lord of the great trees (Vṛkṣāṇāṃ Pati).

verses.transliteration: namo mantriṇe vāṇijāya kakṣāṇām pataye namah
verses.translation: Salutations to the counselor (Mantri), to the merchant (Vāṇija), and to the Lord of the hidden places or thickets (Kakṣāṇāṃ Pati).

verses.transliteration: namo bhuvantaye vārivaskṛtāyauṣadhīnām pataye namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the creator of the world (Bhuvantaye), to the performer of service (Vārivaskṛtāya), and to the Lord of the medicinal herbs (Auṣadhīnāṃ Pati).

verses.transliteration: nama uccair ghoṣāya krandayate pattīnām pataye namo
verses.translation: Salutations to him of loud sound (Uccairghoṣa), to the one who makes others cry (Ākrandayate), and to the Lord of the foot soldiers (Pattīnāṃ Pati).

verses.transliteration: namah kṛtsnavītāya dhāvate satvanām pataye namah
verses.translation: Salutations to the all-encompassing one (Kṛtsnavīta), to the swift runner (Dhāvate), and to the Lord of the courageous ones (Satvanāṃ Pati).

verses.original: नमः सहमानाय निव्याधिन आव्याधिनीनां पतये नमो
verses.transliteration: namah sahamaanaaya nivyaadhina aavyadhiniinam pataye namah
verses.translation: Salutations to the patient one, to the one who strikes in a downward direction, and to the Lord of the groups of people who strike downwards.

verses.transliteration: namah kakubhaya nishanginestenaanam pataye namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the head of a group, to the sword-bearer, and to the Lord of thieves (Stenānāṃ Pati).

verses.transliteration: namo nishangina ishudhimate taskaraanam pataye namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the sword-bearer, to the quiver-bearer, and to the Lord of robbers (Taskarāṇāṃ Pati).

verses.transliteration: namo vanchate pari vanchate stayuunaam pataye namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the deceiver (Vañcate), to the comprehensive deceiver (Parivañcate), and to the Lord of stealers (Stāyūnāṃ Pati).

verses.transliteration: namo nicherave paricharayaranyanam pataye namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the one who moves secretly (Nicerave), to the one who patrols around (Paricarāya), and to the Lord of the forests (Araṇyānāṃ Pati).

verses.transliteration: namah srukavibhyo jighasadbhyo mushnaataam pataye namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the holders of the dart (Sṛkāvi), to the seekers of prey (Jighāsadbhyo), and to the Lord of those who plunder (Muṣṇatāṃ Pati).

verses.original: नमो ऽसिमद्भ्योनक्तं चरद्भ्यः प्रकृन्तानां पतये नमो
verses.transliteration: namo asimadbhyo naktam charadbhyah prakruntanam pataye namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the sword-bearers (Asimadbhyo), to the wanderers by night (Naktaṃ caradbhyah), and to the Lord of the cutters (Prakṛntānāṃ Pati).

verses.original: नम उष्णीषिणे गिरिचराय कुलुञ्चानां पतये नमो
verses.transliteration: nama ushniishine giricharaya kulunchaanam pataye namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the wearer of the turban (Uṣṇīṣine), to the mountain-wanderer (Giricarāya), and to the Lord of the crop-plunderers (Kuluñcānāṃ Pati).

verses.transliteration: nama ishumadbhyo dhanvavibhyascha vo namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the arrow-wielders and to the bow-wielders.

verses.transliteration: nama atanvanebhyah pratida dhane bhyascha vo namo
verses.translation: Salutations to those who string the bow and to those who take aim.

verses.transliteration: nama ayacchadbhyo visrujadbhyascha vo namo
verses.translation: Salutations to those who pull the bow and to those who release the arrows.

verses.transliteration: namo asyadbhyo vidhyad bhyascha vo namo
verses.translation: Salutations to those who shoot and to those who pierce.

verses.transliteration: nama asiinebhyah shayane bhyascha vo namo
verses.translation: Salutations to those who are seated and to those who are lying down.

verses.transliteration: namah svapadbhyo jagrad bhyascha vo namo
verses.translation: Salutations to those who are sleeping and to those who are awake.

verses.transliteration: nama stishthadbhyo dhavad bhyascha vo namo
verses.translation: Salutations to those who are standing and to those who are running.

verses.transliteration: namah sabhabhyah sabhapati bhyascha vo namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the assemblies and to the masters of the assemblies.

verses.transliteration: namo ashvebhyo ashvapati bhyascha vo namah
verses.translation: Salutations to the horses and to the masters of the horses.

verses.transliteration: nama aavyadhinibhyo vividhyanti bhyascha vo namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the groups of those who strike in a downward direction and to the groups of those who strike in various directions.

verses.transliteration: nama uganabhya struhati bhyascha vo namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the fierce groups (Ugaṇābhyas) and to the groups of destroyers (Tṛhatībhyas).

verses.transliteration: namo grutsebhyo grutsapati bhyascha vo namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the greedy ones and to the masters of the greedy ones.

verses.transliteration: namo vraatebhyo vraata pati bhyascha vo namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the organized groups (Vrātebhyo) and to the leaders of the organized groups.

verses.transliteration: namo ganebhyo gaṇapati bhyascha vo namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the hosts (Gaṇebhyo) and to the masters of the hosts (Gaṇapati).

verses.transliteration: namo viruupebhyo vishvarupe bhyascha vo namo
verses.translation: Salutations to those of monstrous forms (Virūpebhyo) and to those of universal forms (Viśvarūpebhyas).

verses.transliteration: namo mahadbhyah kshullake bhyascha vo namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the great ones and to the small ones.

verses.transliteration: namo rathibhyo rathe bhyascha vo namah
verses.translation: Salutations to those who ride chariots (Rathibhyo) and to those who do not (Arathebhyaś).

verses.transliteration: namah senaabhya senani bhyascha vo namah
verses.translation: Salutations to the armies (Senābhyaḥ) and to the commanders of the armies (Senānibhyaś).

verses.transliteration: namah kshattrubhyah sangrahitru bhyascha vo namah
verses.translation: Salutations to the carvers (Kṣattṛbhyaḥ) and to the collectors (Saṃgrahītṛbhyaś).

verses.transliteration: nama stakshabhyo rathakare bhyascha vo namah
verses.translation: Salutations to the carpenters (Takṣabhyo) and to the chariot-makers (Rathakārebhyaś).

verses.transliteration: namah kulalebhyah karmaare bhyascha vo namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the potters (Kulālebhyah) and to the metal workers (Karmārebhyaś).

verses.original: नमः पुञ्जिष्टेभ्यो निषादे भ्यश्च वो नमो
verses.transliteration: namah punjishtebhyo nishade bhyascha vo namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the bird catchers (Puñjiṣṭebhyo) and to the fishermen (Niṣādebhyaś).

verses.transliteration: nama ishukrudbhyo dhanva krud bhyascha vo namah
verses.translation: Salutations to the arrow makers (Iṣukṛdbhyo) and to the bow makers (Dhanvakṛdbhyaś).

verses.transliteration: namo mrugayubhyah shva ni bhyascha vo namo
verses.translation: Salutations to the hunters (Mṛgayubhyah) and to the dog keepers (Śvanibhyaś).

verses.transliteration: namah shvabhyah shvapati bhyascha vo namah
verses.translation: Salutations to the dogs and to the masters of the dogs.

verses.transliteration: namo bhavaaya cha rudraaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to Bhava (existence) and to Rudra (the fiercer aspect).

verses.transliteration: namah sharvaaya cha pashupataye cha
verses.translation: Salutations to Śarva (the destroyer) and to Paśupati (the Lord of all creatures).

verses.transliteration: namo niilagriivaaya cha shiti kanthaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the blue-necked one (Nīlagrīva) and to the white-throated one (Śitikaṇṭha).

verses.transliteration: namah kapardine cha vyuptake shaaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the braided-hair God (Kapardine) and to the one with shaven hair (Vyuptakeśa).

verses.transliteration: namah sahasraakshaaya cha shatadhanvane cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the thousand-eyed one (Sahasrākṣa) and to the wielder of a hundred bows (Śatadhanvane).

verses.transliteration: namo giri shaaya cha shipivishtaaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the mountain dweller (Giriśa) and to the pervader in rays or light (Śipiviṣṭa).

verses.transliteration: namo middhushta maaya cheshumate cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the most generous one (Mīḍhuṣṭama) and to the archer (Iṣumate).

verses.transliteration: namo hrasvaaya cha vaamanaaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the short one (Hrasva) and to the dwarf (Vāmana).

verses.transliteration: namo bruhate cha varshiiyase cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the great one (Bṛhate) and to the oldest (Varṣīyase).

verses.transliteration: namo vruddhaaya cha samvrudhvane cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the aged one (Vṛddha) and to the completely prosperous one (Saṃvṛddhvan).

verses.transliteration: namo agriyaya cha prathamaaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the foremost (Agriyāya) and to the first (Prathamāya).

verses.transliteration: nama aashave chajiraya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the swift one (Āśave) and to the agile one (Ajirāya).

verses.transliteration: namah shiighriyaaya cha shiibhyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one who is in a hurry (Śīghriyāya) and to the one who is quick (Śībhyāya).

verses.transliteration: nama urmyaaya chaavasvanyaaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the waves (Ūrmyāya) and the one in the sound of the waters (Avasvanyāya).

verses.transliteration: namah srotasyaaya cha dviipyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the streams (Srotasyāya) and the one on the islands (Dvīpyāya).

verses.transliteration: namo jyeshthhaaya cha kanishthhaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the oldest (Jyeṣṭha) and to the youngest (Kaniṣṭha).

verses.transliteration: namah purvajaaya chaparajaaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one born before (Pūrvaja) and to the one born later (Aparaja).

verses.transliteration: namo madhyamaaya chapagalbhaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the middle-aged one (Madhyama) and to the immature one (Apagalbha).

verses.transliteration: namo jaghanyaaya cha, budhniyaaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one born at the end (Jaghanya) and to the one at the root (Budhniya).

verses.transliteration: namah shobhyaya cha, prati saryaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the assembly (Śobhya) and to the one who moves everywhere (Pratisarya).

verses.transliteration: namo yaamyaya cha, kshemyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the southern region (Yāmya) and to the one dwelling in peaceful places (Kṣemya).

verses.transliteration: nama urvaryaaya cha khalyaaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the fertile field (Urvaryāya) and to the one in the threshing floor (Khalyāya).

verses.transliteration: nama shlokyaaya chaavasanyaaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the verses of praise (Ślokyāya) and to the one at the conclusion (Avasānyāya).

verses.transliteration: namo vanyaya cha, kakshyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the woods (Vanyāya) and to the one in the thickets (Kakṣyāya).

verses.transliteration: namah shravaya cha pratisravaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the sound (Śravāya) and to the echo (Pratiśravāya).

verses.transliteration: nama asu shenaya chashurathaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one with a swift army (Āśuṣeṇāya) and to the one with a swift chariot (Āśurathāya).

verses.transliteration: nama shuraya cha, chavabhindate cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the hero (Śūrāya) and to the destroyer (Avabhindate).

verses.transliteration: namo varmine cha, varuthine cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the wearer of the armor (Varmiṇe) and to the owner of the chariot (Varūthine).

verses.transliteration: namo bilmine cha kavacine cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the wearer of the helmet (Bilmine) and to the wearer of the breast-plate (Kavacine).

verses.transliteration: namah shrutaya cha shrutasenaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the famous one (Śrutāya) and to the one whose army is famous (Śrutasenāya).

verses.transliteration: namo dundubhyaya chahananyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the drum (Dundubhyāya) and to the one in the drum-stick (Āhananyāya).

verses.transliteration: namo dhrusnave cha pramrushaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the daring one (Dhṛṣṇave) and to the vigilant one (Pramṛśāya).

verses.transliteration: namo duutaya cha, prahitaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the messenger (Dūtāya) and to the emissary (Prahitāya).

verses.transliteration: namo nisangine cheshudhi mate cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the sword-bearer (Niṣaṅgiṇe) and to the quiver-bearer (Iṣudhi Mate).

verses.transliteration: nama steekshneshave chayudhine cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one with sharp arrows (Tīkṣṇeṣave) and to the armed one (Āyudhine).

verses.transliteration: namah svayu dhaya cha sudhanvane cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one with excellent weapons (Svāyudhāya) and to the one with an excellent bow (Sudhanvane).

verses.transliteration: namah srutyaya cha pathyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the narrow path (Srutyāya) and to the one in the wide road (Pathyāya).

verses.transliteration: namah katyaya cha nipyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the rough ground (Kāṭyāya) and to the one in the low-lying ground (Nīpyāya).

verses.transliteration: namah sudyaya cha, sarasyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the muddy water (Sūdyāya) and to the one in the lake (Sarasyāya).

verses.transliteration: namo nadyaya cha, vaishantaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the river (Nādyāya) and to the one in the shallow waters (Vaiśantāya).

verses.transliteration: namah kupyaya chavatyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the well (Kūpyāya) and to the one in the pit (Avaṭyāya).

verses.transliteration: namo varshyaya cha chavarshyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the rain (Varṣyāya) and to the one in the cloudless sky (Avarṣyāya).

verses.transliteration: namo meghyaya cha, vidyutyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the cloud (Meghyāya) and to the one in the lightning (Vidyutyāya).

verses.transliteration: nama idhriyaya chatapyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the hail (Īghriyāya) and to the one in the sunshine (Ātapyāya).

verses.transliteration: namo vatyaya cha, reshmiyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the wind (Vātyāya) and to the one in the dust (Reṣmiyāya).

verses.transliteration: namo vastavyaya cha vastupaya cha.
verses.translation: Salutations to the indweller (Vāstavyāya) and to the protector of the dwelling (Vāstupāya).

verses.original: नमः सोमाय च रुद्राय च नमस्ताम्राय चारुणाय च
verses.transliteration: namah somaya cha rudraya cha namastamraya charunaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one with Uma (Soma) and to Rudra. Salutations to the copper-colored one (Tāmra) and to the reddish one (Aruṇa).

verses.original: नमः शङ्गाय च पशुपतयेच नम उग्राय च भीमाय च
verses.transliteration: nama shangaya cha pashupataye cha nama ugraya cha bhimaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the source of happiness (Śaṅga) and to Paśupati. Salutations to the fierce one (Ugra) and to the terrible one (Bhīma).

verses.transliteration: namo agrevadhaya cha dure vadhaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one who strikes in front (Agrevadha) and to the one who strikes from afar (Dūrevadha).

verses.transliteration: namo hantre cha haniyase cha namo vrukshebhyo harikeshebhyo
verses.translation: Salutations to the destroyer (Hantṛ) and to the most destructive one (Hanīyase). Salutations to the trees and to the one with green hair (Harikeśa).

verses.transliteration: nama staraya namah shambhave cha mayo bhave cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one who helps cross (Tāra). Salutations to the source of peace (Śaṃbhu) and to the source of happiness (Mayobhu).

verses.transliteration: namah shankaraya cha mayaskaraya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the doer of good (Śaṃkara) and to the producer of happiness (Mayaskara).

verses.transliteration: namah shivaya cha shivataraya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the auspicious one (Śiva) and to the most auspicious one (Śivatara).

verses.transliteration: nama stirthyaya cha kulyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the sacred bathing places (Tīrthyāya) and to the one on the banks (Kūlyāya).

verses.transliteration: namah paryaya chavaryaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one on the farther bank (Pāryāya) and to the one on the nearer bank (Avāryāya).

verses.transliteration: namah prataranaya chottaranaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one who makes us cross (Prataraṇa) and to the one who leads us across (Uttaraṇa).

verses.transliteration: nama ataryaya chaladyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one who brings across (Ātārya) and to the source of life-sustaining food (Ālādya).

verses.transliteration: namah shaspyaya cha, phenyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the fresh grass (Śaṣpyāya) and to the one in the foam (Phenyāya).

verses.transliteration: namah sikatya ya cha pravahyaya cha.
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the sand (Sikatyāya) and to the one in the running water (Pravāhyāya).

verses.transliteration: nama irinyaya cha prapayouraya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the barren ground (Iriṇyāya) and to the one on the wide public road (Prapathya).

verses.transliteration: namah kishilya cha kshayanaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the stony soil (Kiśilya) and to the one who dwells in destroying (Kṣayaṇāya).

verses.transliteration: namah kapardine cha pulastayou cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the braided-hair God (Kapardine) and to the powerful one (Pulastaye).

verses.transliteration: namo goshtyaaya cha, grihyaaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the cow pen (Goṣṭhyāya) and to the one in the houses (Gṛhyāya).

verses.transliteration: nama stalpyaya cha, gehyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the couch or bed (Talpyāya) and to the one in the residential dwelling (Gehyāya).

verses.transliteration: namah katyaya cha, gahvareshthaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the pits (Kāṭyāya) and to the one in the depths of caves (Gahvareṣṭhāya).

verses.transliteration: namo hradayyaya cha niveshpya ya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the great pools (Hṛdayyāya) and to the one in the snow (Niveṣpyāya).

verses.transliteration: namah pam savyaya cha rajasyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the dust (Pāṃsavyāya) and to the one in the vapor or twilight (Rajasyāya).

verses.transliteration: nama shushkyaya cha harityaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the dry places (Śuṣkyāya) and to the one in the green places (Harityāya).

verses.transliteration: namo lopyaya cholapya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one in the desolate places (Lopyāya) and to the one in the tangled weeds (Olapya).

verses.transliteration: nama urvyaya cha surmyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one on the earth (Ūrvyāya) and to the one in the beautiful wave (Sūrmyāya).

verses.transliteration: namah panaryaya cha parnashadyaya cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one among the leaves (Parṇyāya) and to the one in the fallen leaves (Parṇaśadyāya).

verses.transliteration: namo paguramanaya chabhighnate cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one who hides (Apaguramāṇāya) and to the one who strikes from nearby (Abhighnate).

verses.transliteration: nama akkhyidate cha, prakkhi date cha
verses.translation: Salutations to the one who afflicts (Ākhidate) and to the one who totally afflicts (Prakhidate).

verses.transliteration: namo vah kirikebhyo devanam hrudayou bhyo
verses.translation: Salutations to the scatterers (Kirikebhyaḥ), who are in the hearts of the gods.

verses.transliteration: namo vikshina kebhyo namo vichinvakte bhyo
verses.translation: Salutations to the scattered ones (Vikṣīṇakebhyaḥ). Salutations to the selective ones (Vicinivattakebhyaḥ).

verses.transliteration: nama anir hatebhyo nama amivaktebhyaha
verses.translation: Salutations to the utterly destructive ones (Ānirhatebhyaḥ). Salutations to the disease-causing ones (Āmīvattakebhyaḥ).

verses.original: द्रापेअन्धसस्पतेदरिद्रन्नीललोहित एषां पुरुषाणामेषां पशूनां मा भेर्मारोमोएषां किंचनाममत्
verses.transliteration: drāpe andha saspate daridran nīlalohita | eṣāṃ puruṣāṇāmeṣāṃ paśūnāṃ mā bhermāro moeṣāṃ kiṃcanāmamat
verses.translation: O Lord, who makes us run away (Drāpa), Lord of food (Andhasaspate), the needy (Daridran), the Blue and Red one (Nīlalohita)! Let there be no fear or injury to these men, these animals, or anything of ours.

verses.original: या तेरुद्र शिवा तनूः शिवा विश्वाह भेषजी शिवा रुद्रस्य भेषजी तया नोमृड जीवसे
verses.transliteration: yā te rudra śivā tanūḥ śivā viśvāha bheṣajī | śivā rudrasya bheṣajī tayā nomṛḍa jīvase
verses.translation: O Rudra, that auspicious form of yours, which is eternally healing, the healing power of Rudra—with that, make us happy to live.

verses.original: इमारुद्राय तवसेकपर्दिनेक्षयद्वीराय प्रभरामहेमतिम् यथा नः शमसद्द्विपदेचतुष्पदेविश्वं पुष्टं ग्रामे अस्मिन्ननातुरम्
verses.transliteration: imā rudrāya tavase kapardine kṣayadvīrāya prabharā mahe matim | yathā naḥ śamasaddvipade catuṣpade viśvaṃ puṣṭaṃ grāme asminnanāturam
verses.translation: We offer this adoration to Rudra, the powerful (Tavase), the braided-hair God (Kapardine), the destroyer of enemies (Kṣayadvīrāya), so that there may be peace for our two-footed and four-footed creatures, and all growth in this village may be free from disease.

verses.original: मृडा नोरुद्रोतनोमयस्कृधि क्षयद्वीराय नमसा विधेम ते यच्छं च योश्च मनुरायजेपिता तदश्याम तव रुद्र प्रणीतौ
verses.transliteration: mṛḍā no rudrota no mayaskṛdhi kṣayadvīrāya namasā vidhema te | yacchamca yośca manurāyaje pitā tadaśyāma tava rudra praṇītau
verses.translation: O Rudra, make us happy and grant us bliss. We worship you, the destroyer of enemies, with salutations. May we attain that which grants peace and happiness, which our father Manu worshipped, by your guidance, O Rudra.

verses.original: मा नोमहान्तमुत मा नोअर्भकं मा न उक्षन्त-मुत मा न उक्षितम् मा नोवधीः पितरं मोत मातरं प्रिया मा नस्तनुवोरुद्र रीरिषः
verses.transliteration: mā no mahānta muta mā no arbhakaṃ mā na ukṣanta-muta mā na ukṣitam | mā no vadhīḥ pitaraṃ mota mātaraṃ priyā mā nastanuvorudra rīriṣaḥ
verses.translation: O Rudra, do not harm our elders, nor our children; do not harm the grown one, nor the embryo. Do not kill our father or our mother. Do not harm our dear bodies.

verses.original: मानस्तोके तनयेमा न आयुषि मा नोगोषु मा नोअश्वेषुरीरिषः वीरान्मा नोरुद्र भामितोऽवधी-र्हविष्मन्तो नमसा विधेम ते
verses.transliteration: mā nastoke tanaye mā na āyuṣi mā no goṣu mā no aśveṣurīriṣaḥ | vīrān mā no rudra bhāmito’vadhī-rhaviṣmanto namasā vidhema te
verses.translation: O Rudra, do not harm our sons, our grandsons, our life, our cows, or our horses. Do not, in your anger, kill our brave men. We, bearing oblations, worship you with salutations.

verses.original: आरात्तेगोघ्न उत्त पूरुषघ्नेक्षयद्वीराय सुम्नमस्मेतेअस्तु रक्षा च नोअधि च देव ब्रूह्यथा च नः शर्म यच्छ द्विबर्हाः
verses.transliteration: ārātte goghna utta pūruṣaghne kṣayadvīrāya sumna masme te astu | rakṣā ca no adhi ca deva brūhyathā ca naḥ śarma yaccha dvibarhāḥ
verses.translation: May that weapon of yours, which kills cows and men, be far from us, O destroyer of enemies. May your favor be upon us. Protect us, O God, speak on our behalf, and grant us double shelter.

verses.original: स्तुहि श्रुतं गर्तसदं युवानं मृगन्न भीम-मुपहत्नुमुग्रम् म्रुडा जरित्रेरुद्र स्तवानोअन्यन्ते अस्मन्निवपन्तुसेनाः
verses.transliteration: stuhi śrutaṃ gartasadaṃ yuvānaṃ mṛganna bhīma-mupahatnumugram | mruda jaritre rudra stavāno anyante asmannivapantu senāḥ
verses.translation: Praise the famous one (Śruta), the mountain-dweller (Gartasada), the youthful one (Yuvāna), the terrible wild beast (Bhīmam), the powerful destroyer (Ugram). O Rudra, praised by the worshipper, be gracious to him. Let your armies strike others, not us.

verses.original: परिणोरुद्रस्य हेतिर्वृणक्तु परि त्वेषस्य दुर्मतिरघायोः अव स्थिरा मघवद्भ्यस्तनुष्व मीढ्वस्तोकाय तनयाय म्रुडय
verses.transliteration: pari no rudrasya hetir vṛṇaktu pari tveṣasya durmati raghāyoḥ | ava sthirā maghavadbhyastanūṣva mīḍhvastokāya tanayāya mṛḍaya
verses.translation: May Rudra's missile turn away from us. May the fierce, evil intention of the wicked turn away from us. O most generous one, loosen your fixed weapons for the benefit of the benevolent ones (Maghavadbhyas), and be gracious to our sons and grandsons.

verses.original: मीढुष्टम शिवतम शिवोनः सुमना भव परमेव्रुक्ष आयुधं निधाय कृत्तिं वसान आचर पिनाकं विभ्रदागहि
verses.transliteration: mīḍhuṣṭama śivatama śivo naḥ sumanā bhava | parame vrukṣa āyudhaṃ nidhāya kṛttiṃ vasāna ācara pinākaṃ vibhradāgahi
verses.translation: O most generous and most auspicious one, be auspicious and kind to us. Place your weapons on a lofty tree, come hither wearing your hide and holding your Pināka (bow).

verses.transliteration: vikirida vilohita namaste astu bhagavaḥ | yāste sahasragam hetayo’nyamasmannivapantu tāḥ
verses.translation: O scatterer (Vikirida), O intensely red one (Vilohita)! Salutations to you, O Lord (Bhagavan). Let those thousand missiles of yours be shot at others, not at us.

verses.original: सहस्राणि सहस्रधा बाहुवोस्तव हेतयः तासामीशानोभगवः पराचीना मुखा कृधि
verses.transliteration: sahasrāṇi sahasradhā bāhuvostava hetayaḥ | tāsāmīśāno bhagavaḥ parācīnā mukhā kṛdhi
verses.translation: Thousands upon thousands of your weapons are in your arms. O Lord (Bhagavan), being the ruler of those, turn their faces away from us.

verses.original: सहस्राणि सहस्रशोयेरुद्रा अधि भूम्याम् तेषासहस्रयोजनेऽवधन्वानि तन्मसि
verses.transliteration: sahasrāṇi sahasraśo ye rudrā adhi bhūmyām | teṣāṃ sahasrayojane’vadhanvāni tanmasi
verses.translation: Thousands and thousands of Rudras who are on the earth—we loosen the strings of their bows a thousand Yojanas away (a vast distance).

verses.transliteration: asmin mahatyarṇaven tarikṣe bhavā adhi
verses.translation: Thousands of Rudras who are in this great ocean (the atmosphere) and in the mid-region (Antarikṣa).

verses.transliteration: nīlagrīvāḥ śitikaṇṭhāḥ śarvā adhaḥ kṣamācarāḥ
verses.translation: The Rudras who are blue-necked, white-throated, and move below, close to the earth (Śarvā adhaḥ kṣamācarāḥ).

verses.transliteration: nīlagrīvāḥ śitikaṇṭhā divam rudrā upaśritāḥ
verses.translation: The Rudras who are blue-necked, white-throated, and dwelling above in the heavens (Divam Rudrā upaśritāḥ).

verses.transliteration: yo vṛkṣeṣu saspinjara nilagriva vilohitaha
verses.translation: The Rudras who are yellowish-red in the trees, blue-necked, and deeply red (Vṛkṣeṣu).

verses.transliteration: yo bhutana madhi patayo vishikhasah kapardianaha
verses.translation: The Rudras who are the lords of created beings (Bhūtānām Adhipatayo), without tufts of hair (Viśikhās), or with matted hair (Kapardinaḥ).

verses.transliteration: you anneshu vividhyanti patresu pibato janaan
verses.translation: The Rudras who strike in the forms of food and drink, or who pierce men through food and drink.

verses.transliteration: yo pathaam pathi rakshaya elabruda yavyudhah
verses.translation: The Rudras who are protectors of paths (Pathirakṣaya), givers of food (Ailabṛda), and fighters (Yavyudhaḥ).

verses.transliteration: yeteerthani pracharanti srukavanto nisanginah
verses.translation: The Rudras who roam the sacred places (Tīrthāni), bearing darts (Sṛkāvanto), and carrying swords (Niṣaṅgiṇaḥ).

verses.original: य एतावन्तश्च भूयासश्च दिशोरुद्रा वितस्थिरे तेषासहस्र-योजने। अवधन्वानि तन्मसि
verses.transliteration: ya etāvanta scha bhuyām sascha diśo rudrā vitasthire | teṣāṃ sahasra-yojane | avadhanvāni tanmasi
verses.translation: The Rudras who are so many and even more, who pervade all directions—we loosen the strings of their bows a thousand Yojanas away.

verses.original: नमोरुद्रेभ्योयेपृथिव्यां ये। अन्तरिक्षे येदिवि येषामन्नं वातोवर्षमिषव-स्तेभ्योदश प्राचीर्दश दक्षिणा दश प्रतीचीर्दशोदीचीर्दशोर्ध्वास्तेभ्यो नमस्तेनोमृडयन्तुतेयं द्विष्मोयश्च नोद्वेष्टि तं वोजम्भेदधामि
verses.transliteration: namo rudrebhyo ye pṛthivyāṃ ye | antarikṣe ye divi yeṣāmannaṃ vāto varṣamiṣava-stebhyo daśa prācīrdaśa dakṣiṇā daśa pratīcīrdaśo dīcīrdaśor dhvāstebhyo namaste no mṛḍayantu teyaṃ dviṣmo yaśca no dveṣṭi taṃ vo jambhe dadhāmi
verses.translation: Salutations to the Rudras who are on earth, who are in the mid-region, and who are in the heavens, whose arrows are food, wind, and rain. To them, ten salutations to the East, ten to the South, ten to the West, ten to the North, and ten above. May they grant us happiness. The one whom we hate and the one who hates us—him I place in your jaws.

verses.original: त्र्यंबकं यजामहेसुगन्धिं पुष्टिवर्धनम्। उर्वारुकमिव बन्धनान्मृत्यो-र्मुक्षीय मामृतात्
verses.transliteration: tryambakaṃ yajāmahe sugandhiṃ puṣṭivardhanam | urvārukamiva bandhanānmṛtyor-mukṣīya māmṛtāt
verses.translation: We worship the three-eyed one (Tryambaka), the fragrant, the nourisher of prosperity. May I be liberated from death, like a cucumber from its stem, but not from immortality.

verses.original: योरुद्रोअग्नौयोअप्सुय ओषधीषु योरुद्रोविश्वा भुवनाऽऽविवेश तस्मैरुद्राय नमोअस्तु
verses.transliteration: yo rudro agnau yo apsu ya oṣadhīṣu | yo rudro viśvā bhuvanā’āviveśa | tasmai rudrāya namo astu
verses.translation: That Rudra who is in the fire, who is in the waters, who is in the herbs, that Rudra who has entered all worlds—to that Rudra be salutation.

verses.original: तमुष्टुहि यः स्विषुः सुधन्वा योविश्वस्य क्षयति भेषजस्य यक्ष्वामहेसौमनसाय रुद्रं नमोभिर्देवमसुरं दुवस्य
verses.transliteration: tamu ṣṭuhi yaḥ sviṣuḥ sudhanvā yo viśvasya kṣayati bheṣajasya | yakṣvāmahe saumanasāya rudraṃ namobhirdevamasuraṃ duvasya
verses.translation: Praise him, the good archer (Sviṣuḥ), the good bowman (Sudhanvā), who destroys the evils of the world with medicine. We worship Rudra, the divine (Deva) and powerful (Asura) one, with salutations for the sake of a tranquil mind (Saumanasāya).

verses.original: अयं मेहस्तोभगवानयं मेभगवत्तरः अयं मेविश्व-भेषजोऽयं शिवाभिमर्शनः
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ mehasto bhagavānayaṃ me bhagavattaraha | ayaṃ me viśvabheṣajo’ya śivābhimarśanaḥ
verses.translation: This hand of mine is indeed the Lord (Bhagavān), this hand is more powerful than the Lord. This hand of mine is the universal remedy, this is the auspicious healing touch.

verses.original: येतेसहस्रमयुतं पाशा मृत्योमर्त्याय हन्तवे। तान् यज्ञस्य मायया सर्वानव यजामहे। मृत्यवेस्वाहा मृत्यवेस्वाहा
verses.transliteration: yo te sahasramayutaṃ pāśā mṛtyo martyāya hantave | tān yajñasya māyayā sarvānava yajāmahe | mṛtyave svāhā, mṛtyave svāhā
verses.translation: O Death (Mṛtyo), the thousands and ten thousands of fetters you have to kill mortals—all of them we offer through the power of Yagña (sacrifice) to you. Svāhā to Death! Svāhā to Death!

verses.original: ओंनमोभगवतेरुद्राय विष्णवेमृत्युर्मे पाहि । प्राणानां ग्रन्थिरसि रुद्रोमा विशान्तकः । तेनान्नेनाप्यायस्व
verses.transliteration: om namo bhagavate rudrāya viṣṇave mṛtyurme pāhi | prāṇānāṃ granthirasi rudro mā viśāntakaḥ | tenān nenāpyāyasva
verses.translation: Om. Salutations to the worshipful Rudra, who is also Vishnu. Protect me from death. You are the knot of the vital airs (Prāṇas). Let Rudra not enter me as the destroyer. Be nourished by that food.

verses.transliteration: Om shaantih shaantih shaantih.
verses.translation: Om. Peace, peace, peace (ending the afflictions of the cosmos, the inner world, and the external world).

verses.original:
ॐ अग्ना॑विष्णो स॒जोष॑से॒माव॑र्धन्तु वा॒-ङ्गिरः॑ ।
द्यु॒म्नैर्वाजे॑भि॒राग॑तम् ।
वाज॑श्च मे प्रस॒वश्च॑ मे॒
प्रय॑तिश्च मे॒ प्रसि॑तिश्च मे
धी॒तिश्च॑ मे क्रतु॑श्च मे॒
स्वर॑श्च मे॒ श्लोक॑श्च मे
श्रा॒वश्च॑ मे॒ श्रुति॑श्च मे॒
ज्योति॑श्च मे॒ सुव॑श्च मे
प्रा॒णश्च॑ मे-ऽपा॒नश्च॑ मे
व्या॒नश्च॒ मे-ऽसु॑श्च मे
चि॒त्त-ञ्च॑ म॒ आधी॑त-ञ्च मे॒
वाक्च॑ मे॒ मन॑श्च मे॒
चक्षु॑श्च मे॒ श्रोत्र॑-ञ्च मे॒
दक्ष॑श्च मे॒ बल॑-ञ्च म॒
ओज॑श्च मे॒ सह॑श्च म॒
आयु॑श्च मे ज॒रा च॑ म
आ॒त्मा च॑ मे त॒नूश्च॑ मे॒
शर्म॑ च मे॒ वर्म॑ च॒ मे-ऽङ्गा॑नि च मे॒-ऽस्थानि॑ च मे॒
परूग्ं॑षि च मे॒ शरी॑राणि च मे ॥ १॥
verses.transliteration:
ōṃ agnā̍viṣṇō sa̠jōṣa̍sē̠māva̍rdhantu vā̠-ṅgira̍ḥ ।
dyu̠mnairvājē̍bhi̠rāga̍tam ।
vāja̍ścha mē prasa̠vaścha̍ mē̠
praya̍tiścha mē̠ prasi̍tiścha mē
dhī̠tiścha̍ mē kratu̍ścha mē̠
svara̍ścha mē̠ ślōka̍ścha mē
śrā̠vaścha̍ mē̠ śruti̍ścha mē̠
jyōti̍ścha mē̠ suva̍ścha mē
prā̠ṇaścha̍ mē-‘pā̠naścha̍ mē
vyā̠naścha̠ mē-‘su̍ścha mē
chi̠tta-ñcha̍ ma̠ ādhī̍ta-ñcha mē̠
vākcha̍ mē̠ mana̍ścha mē̠
chakṣu̍ścha mē̠ śrōtra̍-ñcha mē̠
dakṣa̍ścha mē̠ bala̍-ñcha ma̠
ōja̍ścha mē̠ saha̍ścha ma̠
āyu̍ścha mē ja̠rā cha̍ ma
ā̠tmā cha̍ mē ta̠nūścha̍ mē̠
śarma̍ cha mē̠ varma̍ cha̠ mē-‘ṅgā̍ni cha mē̠-‘sthāni̍ cha mē̠
parūg̍ṃṣi cha mē̠ śarī̍rāṇi cha mē ..1..
verses.translation: O Agni and Vishnu! Delighted together, let these hymns of the Angirasas augment you; come hither with splendor and food! May food be granted to me, and may the urge (to seek it) be granted to me, effort and attainment, thought (understanding) and action (resolve), high tone and renown, hearing and tradition (knowledge), light and heaven, Prana and Apana, Vyana and Asu (life breath), the mind and acquired knowledge, speech and inner thought, sight and hearing, skill and strength, vigor and endurance, life and old age, the Self and the body, protection and armor, limbs and bones, joints and physical bodies.

verses.original:
जैष्ठ्य॑-ञ्च म॒ आधि॑पत्य-ञ्च मे
म॒न्युश्च॑ मे॒ भाम॑श्च॒ मे-ऽम॑श्च॒ मे-ऽम्भ॑श्च मे
जे॒मा च॑ मे महि॒मा च॑ मे
वरि॒मा च॑ मे प्रथि॒मा च॑ मे
व॒र्​ष्मा च॑ मे द्राघु॒या च॑ मे
वृ॒द्ध-ञ्च॑ मे॒ वृद्धि॑श्च मे
स॒त्य-ञ्च॑ मे श्र॒द्धा च॑ मे॒
जग॑च्च मे॒ धन॑-ञ्च मे॒
वश॑श्च मे॒ त्विषि॑श्च मे
क्री॒डा च॑ मे॒ मोद॑श्च मे
जा॒त-ञ्च॑ मे जनि॒ष्यमा॑ण-ञ्च मे
सू॒क्त-ञ्च॑ मे सुकृ॒त-ञ्च॑ मे
वि॒त्त-ञ्च॑ मे॒ वेद्य॑-ञ्च मे
भू॒त-ञ्च॑ मे भवि॒ष्यच्च॑ मे
सु॒ग-ञ्च॑ मे सु॒पथ॑-ञ्च म
ऋ॒द्ध-ञ्च॑ म ऋद्धि॑श्च मे
कॢ॒प्त-ञ्च॑ मे॒ कॢप्ति॑श्च मे
म॒तिश्च॑ मे सुम॒तिश्च॑ मे ॥ २॥
verses.transliteration:
jaiṣṭhya̍-ñcha ma̠ ādhi̍patya-ñcha mē
ma̠nyuścha̍ mē̠ bhāma̍ścha̠ mē-‘ma̍ścha̠ mē-‘mbha̍ścha mē
jē̠mā cha̍ mē mahi̠mā cha̍ mē
vari̠mā cha̍ mē prathi̠mā cha̍ mē
va̠r​ṣmā cha̍ mē drāghu̠yā cha̍ mē
vṛ̠ddha-ñcha̍ mē̠ vṛddhi̍ścha mē
sa̠tya-ñcha̍ mē śra̠ddhā cha̍ mē̠
jaga̍chcha mē̠ dhana̍-ñcha mē̠
vaśa̍ścha mē̠ tviṣi̍ścha mē
krī̠ḍā cha̍ mē̠ mōda̍ścha mē
jā̠ta-ñcha̍ mē jani̠ṣyamā̍ṇa-ñcha mē
sū̠kta-ñcha̍ mē sukṛ̠ta-ñcha̍ mē
vi̠tta-ñcha̍ mē̠ vēdya̍-ñcha mē
bhū̠ta-ñcha̍ mē bhavi̠ṣyachcha̍ mē
su̠ga-ñcha̍ mē su̠patha̍-ñcha ma
ṛ̠ddha-ñcha̍ ma ṛddhi̍ścha mē
kL​i̠pta-ñcha̍ mē̠ kL​ipti̍ścha mē
ma̠tiścha̍ mē suma̠tiścha̍ mē ॥ 2 ॥
verses.translation: May superiority (rank) be granted to me, and may sovereignty be granted to me, indignation and wrath, hurt and terror, victory and greatness, excellence and expansion, vastness and longevity, accumulated gain and increase, truth and faith, the world and wealth, control (over others) and brilliance, play and delight, that which is born and that which is yet to be born, good hymns and meritorious deeds, acquired wealth and that which is to be acquired, the past and the future, easy access and a good path, prosperity (obtained) and prosperity (the power to obtain), capability and capacity, understanding and good understanding.

verses.original:
श-ञ्च॑ मे॒ मय॑श्च मे
प्रि॒य-ञ्च॑ मे-ऽनुका॒मश्च॑ मे॒ काम॑श्च मे
सौमनस॒श्च॑ मे भ॒द्र-ञ्च॑ मे॒
श्रेय॑श्च मे॒ वस्य॑श्च मे॒
यश॑श्च मे॒ भग॑श्च मे॒ द्रवि॑ण-ञ्च मे
य॒न्ता च॑ मे ध॒र्ता च॑ मे॒
क्षेम॑श्च मे॒ धृति॑श्च मे॒
विश्व॑-ञ्च मे॒ मह॑श्च मे
सं॒​विँच्च॑ मे॒ ज्ञात्र॑-ञ्च मे॒
सूश्च॑ मे प्र॒सूश्च॑ मे॒
सीर॑-ञ्च मे ल॒यश्च॑ म
ऋ॒त-ञ्च॑ मे॒-ऽमृत॑-ञ्च मे-ऽय॒क्ष्म-ञ्च॒ मे-ऽना॑मयच्च मे
जी॒वातु॑श्च मे दीर्घायु॒त्व-ञ्च॑ मे-ऽनमि॒त्र-ञ्च॒ मे-ऽभ॑य-ञ्च मे
सु॒ग-ञ्च॑ मे॒ शय॑न-ञ्च मे
सू॒षा च॑ मे सु॒दिन॑-ञ्च मे ॥ ३॥
verses.transliteration:
śa-ñcha̍ mē̠ maya̍ścha mē
pri̠ya-ñcha̍ mē-‘nukā̠maścha̍ mē̠ kāma̍ścha mē
saumanasa̠ścha̍ mē bha̠dra-ñcha̍ mē̠
śrēya̍ścha mē̠ vasya̍ścha mē̠
yaśa̍ścha mē̠ bhaga̍ścha mē̠ dravi̍ṇa-ñcha mē
ya̠ntā cha̍ mē dha̠rtā cha̍ mē̠
kṣēma̍ścha mē̠ dhṛti̍ścha mē̠
viśva̍-ñcha mē̠ maha̍ścha mē
sa̠ṃvichcha̍ mē̠ jñātra̍-ñcha mē̠
sūścha̍ mē pra̠sūścha̍ mē̠
sīra̍-ñcha mē la̠yaścha̍ ma
ṛ̠ta-ñcha̍ mē̠-‘mṛta̍-ñcha mē-‘ya̠kṣma-ñcha̠ mē-‘nā̍mayachcha mē
jī̠vātu̍ścha mē dīrghāyu̠tva-ñcha̍ mē-‘nami̠tra-ñcha̠ mē-‘bha̍ya-ñcha mē
su̠ga-ñcha̍ mē̠ śaya̍na-ñcha mē
sū̠ṣā cha̍ mē su̠dina̍-ñcha mē ॥ 3 ॥
verses.translation: May happiness (from outside) be granted to me, and bliss (from within) be granted to me, pleasantness and that which is according to my wish, desire, goodwill and goodness, merit and greater abundance, fame and fortune, and wealth. May the controller be granted to me, and the supporter, security and firmness, the universe and greatness, perfect knowledge and the means of knowledge, the begetter and progeny, plough and rest (leisure). May the eternal law be granted to me, and immortality, freedom from consumption and freedom from disease, life-span and long life, freedom from enemies and fear, comfortable access and rest (a bed), good birth and a good day.

verses.original:
ऊर्क्च॑ मे सू॒नृता॑ च मे॒
पय॑श्च मे॒ रस॑श्च मे
घृ॒त-ञ्च॑ मे॒ मधु॑ च मे॒
सग्धि॑श्च मे॒ सपी॑तिश्च मे
कृ॒षिश्च॑ मे॒ वृष्टि॑श्च मे॒
जैत्र॑-ञ्च म॒ औद्भि॑द्य-ञ्च मे
र॒यिश्च॑ मे॒ राय॑श्च मे
पु॒ष्ट-ञ्च मे॒ पुष्टि॑श्च मे
वि॒भु च॑ मे प्र॒भु च॑ मे
ब॒हु च॑ मे॒ भूय॑श्च मे
पू॒र्ण-ञ्च॑ मे पू॒र्णत॑र-ञ्च॒ मे-ऽक्षि॑तिश्च मे॒ कूय॑वाश्च॒ मे-ऽन्न॑-ञ्च॒ मे-ऽक्षु॑च्च मे
व्री॒हय॑श्च मे॒ यवा᳚श्च मे॒
माषा᳚श्च मे॒ तिला᳚श्च मे
मु॒द्गाश्च॑ मे ख॒ल्वा᳚श्च मे
गो॒धूमा᳚श्च मे म॒सुरा᳚श्च मे
प्रि॒यङ्ग॑वश्च॒ मे-ऽण॑वश्च मे
श्या॒माका᳚श्च मे नी॒वारा᳚श्च मे ॥ ४॥
verses.transliteration:
ūrkcha̍ mē sū̠nṛtā̍ cha mē̠
paya̍ścha mē̠ rasa̍ścha mē
ghṛ̠ta-ñcha̍ mē̠ madhu̍ cha mē̠
sagdhi̍ścha mē̠ sapī̍tiścha mē
kṛ̠ṣiścha̍ mē̠ vṛṣṭi̍ścha mē̠
jaitra̍-ñcha ma̠ audbhi̍dya-ñcha mē
ra̠yiścha̍ mē̠ rāya̍ścha mē
pu̠ṣṭa-ñcha mē̠ puṣṭi̍ścha mē
vi̠bhu cha̍ mē pra̠bhu cha̍ mē
ba̠hu cha̍ mē̠ bhūya̍ścha mē
pū̠rṇa-ñcha̍ mē pū̠rṇata̍ra-ñcha̠ mē-‘kṣi̍tiścha mē̠ kūya̍vāścha̠ mē-‘nna̍-ñcha̠ mē-‘kṣu̍chcha mē
vrī̠haya̍ścha mē̠ yavā̎ścha mē̠
māṣā̎ścha mē̠ tilā̎ścha mē
mu̠dgāścha̍ mē kha̠lvā̎ścha mē
gō̠dhūmā̎ścha mē ma̠surā̎ścha mē
pri̠yaṅga̍vaścha̠ mē-‘ṇa̍vaścha mē
śyā̠mākā̎ścha mē nī̠vārā̎ścha mē ॥ 4 ॥
verses.translation: May invigorating strength be granted to me, and sweet speech, milk and juice (savour), ghee and honey, eating together and drinking together, cultivation and rain, victory and spontaneous growth of herbs, wealth (cattle) and riches (gold/gems), good nutrition (material) and nourishment (health), pervasive power and supreme power, much and more, fulfillment and greater fulfillment, imperishableness and inferior grain, food and hunger (control over hunger). May rice grains be granted to me, and barley, black beans and sesame seeds, green grams and vetches, wheat and lentils, millet and panic seeds, wild rice and wild millet.

verses.original:
अश्मा॑ च मे॒ मृत्ति॑का च मे
गि॒रय॑श्च मे॒ पर्व॑ताश्च मे॒
सिक॑ताश्च मे॒ वन॒स्पत॑यश्च मे॒
हिर॑ण्य-ञ्च॒ मे-ऽय॑श्च मे॒
सीस॑-ञ्च॒ मे त्रपु॑श्च मे
श्या॒म-ञ्च॑ मे लो॒ह-ञ्च॑ मे-ऽग्निश्च॑ म
आप॑श्च मे वी॒रुध॑श्च म॒ ओष॑धयश्च मे
कृष्टप॒च्य-ञ्च॑ मे-ऽकृष्टपच्य-ञ्च॑ मे
ग्रा॒म्याश्च॑ मे प॒शव॑ आर॒ण्याश्च॑ य॒ज्ञेन॑ कल्पन्तां
वि॒त्त-ञ्च॑ मे॒ वित्ति॑श्च मे
भू॒त-ञ्च॑ मे॒ भूति॑श्च मे॒
वसु॑ च मे वस॒तिश्च॑ मे॒
कर्म॑ च मे॒ शक्ति॑श्च॒ मे-ऽर्थ॑श्च म॒
एम॑श्च म इति॑श्च मे॒ गति॑श्च मे ॥ ५॥
verses.transliteration:
aśmā̍ cha mē̠ mṛtti̍kā cha mē
gi̠raya̍ścha mē̠ parva̍tāścha mē̠
sika̍tāścha mē̠ vana̠spata̍yaścha mē̠
hira̍ṇya-ñcha̠ mē-‘ya̍ścha mē̠
sīsa̍-ñcha̠ mē trapu̍ścha mē
śyā̠ma-ñcha̍ mē lō̠ha-ñcha̍ mē-‘gniścha̍ ma
āpa̍ścha mē vī̠rudha̍ścha ma̠ ōṣa̍dhayaścha mē
kṛṣṭapa̠chya-ñcha̍ mē-‘kṛṣṭapachya-ñcha̍ mē
grā̠myāścha̍ mē pa̠śava̍ āra̠ṇyāścha̍ ya̠jñēna̍ kalpantāṃ
vi̠tta-ñcha̍ mē̠ vitti̍ścha mē
bhū̠ta-ñcha̍ mē̠ bhūti̍ścha mē̠
vasu̍ cha mē vasa̠tiścha̍ mē̠
karma̍ cha mē̠ śakti̍ścha̠ mē-‘rtha̍ścha ma̠
ēma̍ścha ma iti̍ścha mē̠ gati̍ścha mē ॥ 5 ॥
verses.translation: May stone be granted to me, and clay, hills and mountains, sand and large forest trees, gold and bronze, lead and tin, dark iron and red copper, and fire. May waters be granted to me, and creepers, and herbs, cultivated crops and wild crops. May the domestic animals and wild animals be prepared (for the sacrifice) by the sacrifice. May acquired wealth be granted to me, and the means of acquisition, existence and power, treasure and dwelling place, religious rite and power, and purpose, movement (going), arrival (reaching the destination), and the path.

verses.original:
अ॒ग्निश्च॑ म॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे॒
सोम॑श्च म॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे
सवि॒ता च॑ म॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे॒
सर॑स्वती च म॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे
पू॒षा च॑ म॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे॒
बृह॒स्पति॑श्च म॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे
मि॒त्रश्च॑ म॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे॒
वरु॑णश्च म॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे॒
त्वष्ठा॑ च म॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे
धा॒ता च॑ म॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे॒
विष्णु॑श्च म॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे-ऽश्विनौ॑ च म॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे
म॒रुत॑श्च म॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे॒
विश्वे॑ च मे दे॒वा इन्द्र॑श्च मे
पृथि॒वी च॑ म॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे-ऽन्तरि॑क्ष-ञ्च म॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे
द्यौश्च॑ म॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे॒
दिश॑श्च म॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे
मू॒र्धा च॑ म॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे
प्र॒जाप॑तिश्च म॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे ॥ ६॥
verses.transliteration:
a̠gniścha̍ ma̠ indra̍ścha mē̠
sōma̍ścha ma̠ indra̍ścha mē
savi̠tā cha̍ ma̠ indra̍ścha mē̠
sara̍svatī cha ma̠ indra̍ścha mē
pū̠ṣā cha̍ ma̠ indra̍ścha mē̠
bṛha̠spati̍ścha ma̠ indra̍ścha mē
mi̠traścha̍ ma̠ indra̍ścha mē̠
varu̍ṇaścha ma̠ indra̍ścha mē̠
tvaṣṭhā̍ cha ma̠ indra̍ścha mē
dhā̠tā cha̍ ma̠ indra̍ścha mē̠
viṣṇu̍ścha ma̠ indra̍ścha mē-‘śvinau̍ cha ma̠ indra̍ścha mē
ma̠ruta̍ścha ma̠ indra̍ścha mē̠
viśvē̍ cha mē dē̠vā indra̍ścha mē
pṛthi̠vī cha̍ ma̠ indra̍ścha mē-‘ntari̍kṣa-ñcha ma̠ indra̍ścha mē
dyauścha̍ ma̠ indra̍ścha mē̠
diśa̍ścha ma̠ indra̍ścha mē
mū̠rdhā cha̍ ma̠ indra̍ścha mē
pra̠jāpa̍tiścha ma̠ indra̍ścha mē ॥ 6 ॥
verses.translation: May Agni and Indra be granted to me, Soma and Indra, Savitr and Indra, Sarasvati and Indra, Pūṣan and Indra, Bṛhaspati and Indra, Mitra and Indra, Varuṇa and Indra, Tvaṣṭr and Indra, Dhātṛ and Indra, Viṣṇu and Indra, the Aśvins and Indra, the Maruts and Indra, the Viśve Devas and Indra, Earth and Indra, Atmosphere and Indra, Sky and Indra, directions and Indra, the highest point (Mūrdhā) and Indra, Prajāpati and Indra.

verses.original:
अ॒ग्ं॒शुश्च॑ मे र॒श्मिश्च॒ मे-ऽदा᳚भ्यश्च॒ मे-ऽधि॑पतिश्च म
उपा॒ग्ं॒शुश्च॑ मे-ऽन्तर्या॒मश्च॑ म
ऐन्द्रवाय॒वश्च॑ मे मैत्रावरु॒णश्च॑ म
आश्वि॒नश्च॑ मे प्रतिप्र॒स्थान॑श्च मे
शु॒क्रश्च॑ मे म॒न्थी च॑ म
आग्रय॒णश्च॑ मे वैश्वदे॒वश्च॑ मे
ध्रु॒वश्च॑ मे वैश्वान॒रश्च॑ म
ऋतुग्र॒हाश्च॑ मे-ऽतिग्रा॒ह्या᳚श्च म
ऐन्द्रा॒ग्नश्च॑ मे वैश्वदे॒वश्च॑ मे
मरुत्व॒तीया᳚श्च मे माहे॒न्द्रश्च॑ म
आदि॒त्यश्च॑ मे सावि॒त्रश्च॑ मे
सारस्व॒तश्च॑ मे पौ॒ष्णश्च॑ मे
पात्नीव॒तश्च॑ मे हारियोज॒नश्च॑ मे ॥ ७॥
verses.transliteration:
a̠gṃ̠śuścha̍ mē ra̠śmiścha̠ mē-‘dā̎bhyaścha̠ mē-‘dhi̍patiścha ma
upā̠gṃ̠śuścha̍ mē-‘ntaryā̠maścha̍ ma
aindravāya̠vaścha̍ mē maitrāvaru̠ṇaścha̍ ma
āśvi̠naścha̍ mē pratipra̠sthāna̍ścha mē
śu̠kraścha̍ mē ma̠nthī cha̍ ma
āgraya̠ṇaścha̍ mē vaiśvadē̠vaścha̍ mē
dhru̠vaścha̍ mē vaiśvāna̠raścha̍ ma
ṛtugra̠hāścha̍ mē-‘tigrā̠hyā̎ścha ma
aindrā̠gnaścha̍ mē vaiśvadē̠vaścha̍ mē
marutva̠tīyā̎ścha mē māhē̠ndraścha̍ ma
ādi̠tyaścha̍ mē sāvi̠traścha̍ mē
sārasva̠taścha̍ mē pau̠ṣṇaścha̍ mē
pātnīva̠taścha̍ mē hāriyōja̠naścha̍ mē ॥ 7 ॥
verses.translation: May the Aṁśu (Soma vessel) and the Raśmi (Soma ray) be granted to me, the Adābhya (vessel) and the Adhipati (vessel). May the Upāṁśu (libation) and the Antaryāma (libation) be granted to me. May the Aindravāyava (Graha) and the Maitrāvaruṇa (Graha) be granted to me. May the Āśvina (Graha) and the Pratiprasthāna (Graha) be granted to me. May the Śukra (Graha) and the Manthin (Graha) be granted to me. May the Āgrayaṇa (Graha) and the Vaiśvadeva (Graha) be granted to me. May the Dhruva (Graha) and the Vaiśvānara (Graha) be granted to me. May the Ṛtugrahas (seasonal libations) and the Atigrāhyas (extra libations) be granted to me. May the Aindrāgna (Graha) and the Vaiśvadeva (Graha) be granted to me. May the Marutvatīyas (Graha) and the Māhendra (Graha) be granted to me. May the Āditya (Graha) and the Sāvitra (Graha) be granted to me. May the Sārasvata (Graha) and the Pauṣṇa (Graha) be granted to me. May the Pātnīvata (Graha) and the Hāriyojana (Graha) be granted to me. (All these are names of Soma cups/libations used in the Soma sacrifice.)

verses.original:
इ॒ध्मश्च॑ मे ब॒र्​हिश्च॑ मे॒
वेदि॑श्च मे॒ दिष्णि॑याश्च मे॒
स्रुच॑श्च मे चम॒साश्च॑ मे॒
ग्रावा॑णश्च मे॒ स्वर॑वश्च म
उपर॒वाश्च॑ मे-ऽधि॒षव॑णे च मे
द्रोणकल॒शश्च॑ मे वाय॒व्या॑नि च मे
पूत॒भृच्च॑ म आधव॒नीय॑श्च म॒
आग्नी᳚ध्र-ञ्च मे हवि॒र्धान॑-ञ्च मे
गृ॒हाश्च॑ मे॒ सद॑श्च मे पुरो॒डाशा᳚श्च मे
पच॒ताश्च॑ मे-ऽवभृथश्च॑ मे स्वगाका॒रश्च॑ मे ॥ ८॥
verses.transliteration:
i̠dhmaścha̍ mē ba̠r​hiścha̍ mē̠
vēdi̍ścha mē̠ diṣṇi̍yāścha mē̠
srucha̍ścha mē chama̠sāścha̍ mē̠
grāvā̍ṇaścha mē̠ svara̍vaścha ma
upara̠vāścha̍ mē-‘dhi̠ṣava̍ṇē cha mē
drōṇakala̠śaścha̍ mē vāya̠vyā̍ni cha mē
pūta̠bhṛchcha̍ ma ādhava̠nīya̍ścha ma̠
āgnī̎dhra-ñcha mē havi̠rdhāna̍-ñcha mē
gṛ̠hāścha̍ mē̠ sada̍ścha mē purō̠ḍāśā̎ścha mē
pacha̠tāścha̍ mē-‘vabhṛthaścha̍ mē svagākā̠raścha̍ mē ॥ 8 ॥
verses.translation: May the fuel (wood) be granted to me, and the sacred grass (barhis), the altar (vedi) and the special hearths (diṣṇiya), the sacrificial ladles (sruc) and the Soma cups (camasa), the pressing stones (grāva) and the other stones (svara), the deep trenches (uparava) and the pressing boards (adhiṣavaṇa). May the Drona-kalaśa (Soma vessel) and the Vāyavyas (vessels) be granted to me, the Pūtabhṛt (purifying vessel) and the Ādhavanīya (mixing vessel), the Āgnīdhra (priest's place) and the Havirdhāna (cart shed), the sheds and the assembly hall (sadas), the sacrificial cakes (puroḍāśa), the things to be cooked, the final purification bath (avabhṛtha), and the exclamation of 'svagā' (for offering).

verses.original:
अ॒ग्निश्च॑ मे घ॒र्मश्च॑ मे॒-ऽर्कश्च॑ मे॒
सूर्य॑श्च मे प्रा॒णश्च॑ मे-ऽश्वमे॒धश्च॑ मे
पृथि॒वी च॒ मे-ऽदि॑तिश्च मे॒ दिति॑श्च मे॒
द्यौश्च॑ मे॒ शक्व॑रीर॒ङ्गुल॑यो॒ दिश॑श्च मे
य॒ज्ञेन॑ कल्पन्ता॒मृक्च॑ मे॒
साम॑ च मे॒ स्तोम॑श्च मे॒
यजु॑श्च मे दी॒क्षा च॑ मे॒
तप॑श्च म ऋ॒तुश्च॑ मे
व्र॒त-ञ्च॑ मे-ऽहोरा॒त्रयो᳚र्वृ॒ष्ट्या बृ॑हद्रथन्त॒रे च॒ मे
य॒ज्ञेन॑ कल्पेताम् ॥ ९॥
verses.transliteration:
a̠gniścha̍ mē gha̠rmaścha̍ mē̠-‘rkaścha̍ mē̠
sūrya̍ścha mē prā̠ṇaścha̍ mē-‘śvamē̠dhaścha̍ mē
pṛthi̠vī cha̠ mē-‘di̍tiścha mē̠ diti̍ścha mē̠
dyauścha̍ mē̠ śakva̍rīra̠ṅgula̍yō̠ diśa̍ścha mē
ya̠jñēna̍ kalpantā̠mṛkcha̍ mē̠
sāma̍ cha mē̠ stōma̍ścha mē̠
yaju̍ścha mē dī̠kṣā cha̍ mē̠
tapa̍ścha ma ṛ̠tuścha̍ mē
vra̠ta-ñcha̍ mē-‘hōrā̠trayō̎rvṛ̠ṣṭyā bṛ̍hadrathanta̠rē cha̠ mē
ya̠jñēna̍ kalpētām ॥ 9 ॥
verses.translation: May Agni (fire) be granted to me, and Ghārma (the hot milk libation), the Arkā (sun) and the Sūrya (sun), Prāṇa (life-breath) and the Aśvamedha (horse sacrifice). May Earth be granted to me, and Aditi (boundless freedom) and Diti (limitation), Sky, the Śakvarī fingers (the digits of the hand), and the directions. May the Ṛk verses be prepared (by the sacrifice), and the Sāma (melodies), the Stoma (hymns of praise), the Yajus (prose formulas), the Dīkṣā (consecration), penance (Tapas), the season (Ṛtu), the sacred vow (Vrata). May the Bṛhat and Rathantara Sāmans (famous Sāman melodies) through the rain of day and night be prepared by the sacrifice.

verses.original:
गर्भा᳚श्च मे व॒त्साश्च॑ मे॒
त्र्यवि॑श्च मे त्र्य॒वीच॑ मे
दित्य॒वाट् च॑ मे दित्यौ॒ही च॑ मे॒
पञ्चा॑विश्च मे पञ्चा॒वी च॑ मे
त्रिव॒त्सश्च॑ मे त्रिव॒त्सा च॑ मे
तुर्य॒वाट् च॑ मे तुर्यौ॒ही च॑ मे
पष्ठ॒वाट् च॑ मे पष्ठौ॒ही च॑ म
उ॒क्षा च॑ मे व॒शा च॑ म
ऋष॒भश्च॑ मे वे॒हच्च॑ मे-ऽन॒ड्वाञ्च मे
धे॒नुश्च॑ म॒ आयु॑र्य॒ज्ञेन॑ कल्पतां
प्रा॒णो य॒ज्ञेन॑ कल्पतामपा॒नो य॒ज्ञेन॑ कल्पतां॒
व्या॒नो य॒ज्ञेन॑ कल्पतां॒
चक्षु॑र्य॒ज्ञेन॑ कल्पता॒ग्॒ श्रोत्रं॑-यँ॒ज्ञेन॑ कल्पतां॒
मनो॑ य॒ज्ञेन॑ कल्पतां॒
वाग्य॒ज्ञेन॑ कल्पतामा॒त्मा य॒ज्ञेन॑ कल्पतां
य॒ज्ञो य॒ज्ञेन॑ कल्पताम् ॥ १०॥
verses.transliteration:
garbhā̎ścha mē va̠tsāścha̍ mē̠
tryavi̍ścha mē trya̠vīcha̍ mē
ditya̠vāṭ cha̍ mē dityau̠hī cha̍ mē̠
pañchā̍viścha mē pañchā̠vī cha̍ mē
triva̠tsaścha̍ mē triva̠tsā cha̍ mē
turya̠vāṭ cha̍ mē turyau̠hī cha̍ mē
paṣṭha̠vāṭ cha̍ mē paṣṭhau̠hī cha̍ ma
u̠kṣā cha̍ mē va̠śā cha̍ ma
ṛṣa̠bhaścha̍ mē vē̠hachcha̍ mē-‘na̠ḍvāñcha mē
dhē̠nuścha̍ ma̠ āyu̍rya̠jñēna̍ kalpatāṃ
prā̠ṇō ya̠jñēna̍ kalpatāmapā̠nō ya̠jñēna̍ kalpatā̠ṃ
vyā̠nō ya̠jñēna̍ kalpatā̠ṃ
chakṣu̍rya̠jñēna̍ kalpatā̠g̠ śrōtra̍ṃ ya̠jñēna̍ kalpatā̠ṃ
manō̍ ya̠jñēna̍ kalpatā̠ṃ
vāgya̠jñēna̍ kalpatāmā̠tmā ya̠jñēna̍ kalpatāṃ
ya̠jñō ya̠jñēna̍ kalpatām ॥ 10 ॥
verses.translation: May embryo (garbha) be granted to me, and calves (vatsa), three-year-old steer and heifer (tryavi and tryavī), two-year-old steer and heifer (dityavāṭ and dityauhī), five-year-old steer and heifer (pañcāvi and pañcāvī), three-year-old male and female (trivatsa and trivatsā), four-year-old steer and heifer (turyavāṭ and turyauhī), six-year-old steer and heifer (paṣṭhavāṭ and paṣṭauhī). May bull (ukṣā) be granted to me, and barren cow (vaśā), male bull (ṛṣabha), abortive cow (vehat), draft ox (anaḍvān), milch cow (dhenu). May life (āyu) be prepared by the sacrifice. May Prāṇa be prepared by the sacrifice, Apāna be prepared by the sacrifice, Vyāna be prepared by the sacrifice, sight be prepared by the sacrifice, hearing be prepared by the sacrifice, mind be prepared by the sacrifice, speech be prepared by the sacrifice, the self (ātman) be prepared by the sacrifice, the sacrifice itself be prepared by the sacrifice.

verses.original:
एका॑ च मे ति॒स्रश्च॑ मे॒
पञ्च॑ च मे स॒प्त च॑ मे॒
नव॑ च म॒ एका॑दश च मे॒
त्रयो॑दश च मे॒ पञ्च॑दश च मे
स॒प्तद॑श च मे॒ नव॑दश च म॒
एक॑विग्ंशतिश्च मे॒ त्रयो॑विग्ंशतिश्च मे॒
पञ्च॑विग्ंशतिश्च मे स॒प्तविग्ं॑शतिश्च मे॒
नव॑विग्ंशतिश्च म॒ एक॑त्रिग्ंशच्च मे॒
त्रय॑स्त्रिग्ंशच्च मे॒ चत॑स्रश्च मे॒-ऽष्टौ च॑ मे॒
द्वाद॑श च मे॒ षोड॑श च मे
विग्ंश॒तिश्च॑ मे॒ चतु॑र्विग्ंशतिश्च मे॒-ऽष्टाविग्ं॑शतिश्च मे॒
द्वात्रिग्ं॑शच्च मे॒ षट्-त्रिग्ं॑शच्च मे
चत्वारि॒ग्ं॒शच्च॑ मे॒ चतु॑श्चत्वारिग्ंशच्च मे-ऽष्टाच॑त्वारिग्ंशच्च मे॒
वाज॑श्च प्रस॒वश्चा॑पि॒जश्च
क्रतु॑श्च॒ सुव॑श्च मू॒र्धा च॒
व्यश्नि॑यश्चान्त्याय॒नश्चान्त्य॑श्च
भौव॒नश्च॒ भुव॑न॒श्चाधि॑पतिश्च ॥ ११॥
verses.transliteration:
ēkā̍ cha mē ti̠sraścha̍ mē̠
pañcha̍ cha mē sa̠pta cha̍ mē̠
nava̍ cha ma̠ ēkā̍daśa cha mē̠
trayō̍daśa cha mē̠ pañcha̍daśa cha mē
sa̠ptada̍śa cha mē̠ nava̍daśa cha ma̠
ēka̍vigṃśatiścha mē̠ trayō̍vigṃśatiścha mē̠
pañcha̍vigṃśatiścha mē sa̠ptavig̍ṃśatiścha mē̠
nava̍vigṃśatiścha ma̠ ēka̍trigṃśachcha mē̠
traya̍strigṃśachcha mē̠ chata̍sraścha mē̠-‘ṣṭau cha̍ mē̠
dvāda̍śa cha mē̠ ṣōḍa̍śa cha mē
vigṃśa̠tiścha̍ mē̠ chatu̍rvigṃśatiścha mē̠-‘ṣṭāvig̍ṃśatiścha mē̠
dvātrig̍ṃśachcha mē̠ ṣaṭ-trig̍ṃśachcha mē
chatvāri̠g̠ṃśachcha̍ mē̠ chatu̍śchatvārigṃśachcha mē-‘ṣṭācha̍tvārigṃśachcha mē̠
vāja̍ścha prasa̠vaśchā̍pi̠jaścha
kratu̍ścha̠ suva̍ścha mū̠rdhā cha̠
vyaśni̍yaśchāntyāya̠naśchāntya̍ścha
bhauva̠naścha̠ bhuva̍na̠śchādhi̍patiścha ॥ 11 ॥
verses.translation: May one be granted to me, and three, and five, and seven, and nine, and eleven, and thirteen, and fifteen, and seventeen, and nineteen, and twenty-one, and twenty-three, and twenty-five, and twenty-seven, and twenty-nine, and thirty-one, and thirty-three (odd numbers for Stomas). May four be granted to me, and eight, and twelve, and sixteen, and twenty, and twenty-four, and twenty-eight, and thirty-two, and thirty-six, and forty, and forty-four, and forty-eight (even numbers for Stomas). May food (Vāja) be granted, and quickening (Prasava), and conquest (Abhijit), and will (Kratu), and heaven (Suva), and summit (Mūrdhā), and pervasiveness (Vyaśniya), and the final point (Antyāyana), and the end (Antya), the Earth (Bhauvana), the World (Bhuvana), and the Overlord (Adhipati).

verses.original:
ॐ इडा॑ देव॒हू-र्मनु॑र्यज्ञ॒नी-र्बृह॒स्पति॑रुक्थाम॒दानि॑
शग्ंसिष॒द्विश्वे॑ दे॒वा-स्सू᳚क्त॒वाचः॒ पृथि॑विमात॒र्मा
मा॑ हिग्ंसी॒र्म॒धु॑ मनिष्ये॒ मधु॑ जनिष्ये॒
मधु॑ वक्ष्यामि॒ मधु॑ वदिष्यामि॒
मधु॑मती-न्दे॒वेभ्यो॒ वाच॒मुद्यासग्ंशुश्रूषे॒ण्या᳚म्
मनु॒ष्ये᳚भ्य॒स्तं
मा॑ दे॒वा अ॑वन्तु शो॒भायै॑ पि॒तरो-ऽनु॑मदन्तु ॥
ॐ शान्ति॒-श्शान्ति॒-श्शान्तिः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration:
ōṃ iḍā̍ dēva̠hū-rmanu̍ryajña̠nī-rbṛha̠spati̍rukthāma̠dāni̍
śagṃsiṣa̠dviśvē̍ dē̠vā-ssū̎kta̠vācha̠ḥ pṛthi̍vimāta̠rmā
mā̍ higṃsī̠rma̠dhu̍ maniṣyē̠ madhu̍ janiṣyē̠
madhu̍ vakṣyāmi̠ madhu̍ vadiṣyāmi̠
madhu̍matī-ndē̠vēbhyō̠ vācha̠mudyāsagṃśuśrūṣē̠ṇyā̎m
manu̠ṣyē̎bhya̠staṃ
mā̍ dē̠vā a̍vantu śō̠bhāyai̍ pi̠tarō-‘nu̍madantu ॥
ōṃ śānti̠-śśānti̠-śśānti̍ḥ ॥
verses.translation: Oṃ! May Iḍā (the Earth/Food), the invoker of the gods, Manu, the leader of the sacrifice, and Bṛhaspati, the speaker of songs (uktha) of intoxication, and the Viśve Devas, the speakers of good hymns—may they bless me. O Mother Earth, do not injure me. I shall think sweetly, I shall generate sweetness, I shall speak sweetness, I shall utter sweetness, I shall utter for the gods a speech full of honey, and for men, speech that is worthy of being heard. May the gods protect me for the sake of splendor. May the ancestors approve of me. Oṃ! Peace, Peace, Peace.
